alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Essex; Hanover; King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 22 at 2:31PM EDT until June 22 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN KING AND QUEEN...NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND... CAROLINE...HANOVER...NORTHWESTERN KING WILLIAM AND NORTHWESTERN ESSEX COUNTIES... At 231 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Nanjemoy Creek to near Potomac Creek to near Spotsylvania, moving south at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Bowling Green, Port Royal and Ladysmith around 255 PM EDT. Milford around 300 PM EDT. Fort A.p. Hill and Loretto around 305 PM EDT. Ashland, Montpelier, Dawn, Kings Dominion and Newtown around 315 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Chilesburg, Beazley, Golansville, Hustle, Guinea, Corbin, Vontay, Gum Tree, Elevon and Supply. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Essex; Hanover; King and Queen
